description:
time: added Duration conversion example.

I'm learning Go, and today I needed to create a time.Duration from a variable, but I couldn't figure it out from the docs. I eventually found the answer in an rsc comment on a CL:
http://mail.codereview.appspot.com/5505064/#msg9

This example is based on that comment. Please consider adding it to the documentation to help future searchers. Thanks!

Fixed by: 5696078

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com, rsc@golang.org),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

Thanks. I think what's really missing is an explanation of how to use the constants in the doc comment. I'll address that. I've been confused myself.

-rob

On 2012/02/26 08:49:21, r2 wrote:
> Thanks. I think what's really missing is an explanation of how to use the
> constants in the doc comment. I'll address that. I've been confused myself.
> 
> -rob
> 

Thanks for the thorough update in 5696078!

Take care,
-Brian

subject: code review 5698069:     time: added Duration conversion example.
